core_principles: Write for humans first, algorithms second
Use keywords naturally throughout the review
Think like a buyer when selecting keywords
Focus on providing context around keywords

keyword_categories.name: primaryKeywords
keyword_categories.description: What someone would type to find this product
keyword_categories.search_intent: Users looking for the specific product or category

keyword_categories.name: featureKeywords
keyword_categories.description: Specific features or benefits searchers look for
keyword_categories.search_intent: Users seeking products with specific attributes

keyword_categories.name: comparisonKeywords
keyword_categories.description: Terms related to alternatives and competitors
keyword_categories.search_intent: Users comparing products before purchase decision
implementation: Use when directly comparing with alternatives

keyword_categories.name: compatibilityKeywords
keyword_categories.description: Terms about what the product works with
keyword_categories.search_intent: Users verifying product will work with existing equipment
implementation: Include in technical or compatibility sections
Use when discussing integration with other products

keyword_categories.name: traditionalSolutionKeywords
keyword_categories.description: Terms about what the product replaces or improves upon
keyword_categories.search_intent: Users looking to upgrade from traditional methods
implementation: Include when discussing how product improves upon older methods
Use in experiential narratives about product benefits

keyword_categories.name: accessoryKeywords
keyword_categories.description: Terms about additional items that complement the product
keyword_categories.search_intent: Users looking to complete their purchase with accessories
implementation: Include when discussing ecosystem or add-ons

keyword_categories.name: problemSolutionKeywords
keyword_categories.description: Terms related to specific pain points the product addresses
keyword_categories.search_intent: Users seeking solutions to specific problems
implementation: Include in experiential or solution-focused sections
Use when describing specific use cases

implementation_process.description: Systematic approach to keyword identification and placement
integration_points: See content-structure.json > core_elements for optimal keyword placement locations
See writing-process.json > initial_capture_and_analysis for keyword identification workflow

pre_review_keyword_brainstorm.description: Process for identifying potential keywords before writing begins

questions: What would someone type to find this specific product?
What general category does this product belong to?
steps.output: List of 3-5 primary category and product keywords

questions: What specific features would buyers search for?
What performance aspects would be searched?
steps.output: List of 5-8 feature and specification keywords

questions: What are the main competing products or brands?
What might someone type when comparing options?
steps.output: List of 2-4 comparative keywords or phrases

questions: What devices/systems/products does this work with?
What compatibility issues might users search for?
What specific problems does this product solve?
What frustrations might lead someone to search for this?

keyword_selection_criteria.description: Framework for prioritizing which keywords to include

criteria.name: searchVolume
criteria.description: How frequently the term is searched
criteria.assessment: Based on reviewer's knowledge of product category

criteria.name: relevance
criteria.description: How closely the keyword relates to the product's core purpose
criteria.assessment: Directly relates to primary product function or key differentiator

criteria.name: differentiation
criteria.description: How well the keyword helps distinguish from similar products
criteria.assessment: Highlights unique aspects or specific strengths

criteria.name: searchability
criteria.description: How likely buyers are to use this exact term
criteria.assessment: Uses common terminology rather than jargon when possible

placement_strategy.description: Strategic locations within review for keyword placement

guidelines: Set context with product category terms
Avoid awkward phrasing to include keywords
Include measurement units and specific values
Use terminology buyers would search for
Include ideal use cases with relevant terms
Reference key benefits with targeted terminology

natural_integration_techniques.description: Methods for incorporating keywords naturally without affecting readability

techniques.name: contextualEnhancement
techniques.implementation: Add specific details that would help buyers understand the keyword in context

techniques.name: variantUsage
techniques.description: Using different forms of the same keyword
techniques.implementation: Use different word forms, related terms, and natural variations

techniques.name: experienceIntegration
techniques.implementation: Weave keywords into specific usage scenarios and authentic experiences

techniques.name: comparativeFraming
techniques.implementation: Include relevant comparison keywords within specific, detailed contrasts

verification_framework.description: Process for ensuring effective keyword implementation

pre_submission_checks.method: Verify that keywords appear throughout the review rather than being concentrated in one section
pre_submission_checks.acceptance: Keywords naturally distributed across at least 3 different sections
No more than 2-3 usages of the exact same keyword form

pre_submission_checks.method: Read sections with keywords aloud to verify they sound natural
pre_submission_checks.acceptance: No awkward phrasing or unnatural constructions

pre_submission_checks.method: Verify that keywords are surrounded by valuable information
pre_submission_checks.acceptance: Each keyword usage provides helpful context for buyers

best_practices: Use keyword variations and synonyms for natural flow
Incorporate keywords that potential buyers might search for
Avoid keyword stuffing or repetitive phrasing
Focus on creating value for human readers while incorporating search terms
Use specific product model numbers and technical specifications when relevant
Include comparative terms naturally within experience narratives
Balance search optimization with readability and authentic voice

pre_writing_planning.description: During the Pre-Writing Planning phase of writing-process.json, ensure the following keyword-related tasks are completed
tasks: Identify primary keywords based on product category and features
Identify secondary keywords related to benefits, usage, and comparisons
Plan keyword placement within the review structure (title, opening, body)
Consider keyword variations and long-tail keywords for natural integration

content_creation.description: During the Content Creation phase of writing-process.json, ensure the following keyword-related tasks are completed
tasks: Integrate primary keywords naturally into the title and opening
Weave secondary keywords into the body of the review
Use keyword variations to maintain natural flow and avoid repetition
Include long-tail keywords where appropriate to capture specific user searches
